intro: Ophrys scolopax var. honckensis, commonly known as the Honken’s bee orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to specific regions of Europe. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, which closely resembles a female bee, a mimicry adaptation that aids in pollination by male bees. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and heaths. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to brownish in color, with intricate patterns that enhance its mimicry. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, this variety is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
